required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prognostic Value of Lung Ultrasound in ST Segment Elevation Acute Myocardial Infarction (LUS-AMI)
clinical_study.official_title: Prognostic Value of Lung Ultrasound in ST Segment Elevation Acute Myocardial Infarction (LUS-AMI)

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

collaborator.agency: Institut Hospital del Mar d'Investigacions Médiques

clinical_study.source: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to asses the prognostic value of lung ultrasound in patients with ST-segment elevation acute myocardial infarction.

detailed_description.textblock:
LUS-AMI is an observational cohort prospective study that evaluates the prognostic value of lung ultrasound, specifically the number of B-lines, performed within the first 24 hours after and ST-segment elevation acute myocardial infarction, by an independent operator blinded to clinical outcomes and off-line analysis by another independent operator also blinded to clinical outcomes.
Follow-up is six months after STEMI and the primary outcome is a composite of any cause mortality, hospitalization secondary to cardiovascular disease (acute coronary syndrome, heart failure or stroke) or need for urgent coronary revascularization. Secondary outcomes are each event composing primary outcome separately, new onset heart failure during hospitalization, acute kidney injury during hospitalization, new onset clinically relevant arrythmia (atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter, ventricular tachycardia, ventricular fibrillation) or unexpected consultation secondary to heart failure.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary combined outcome: incidence of any cause mortality, hospitalization secondary to cardiovascular cause or urgent requirement of coronary revascularization.
primary_outcome.description: Combined outcome of: mortality from any cause, readmission due to cardiovascular cause (acute coronary syndrome, heart failure or stroke) or the need for urgent coronary revascularization at a 6-month follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until discharge from the hospital (an average of 1 week) or up to one month after admission
secondary_outcome.description: Heart failure, defined as compatible clinical syndrome and elevated natriuretic peptides (> 450 pg / dl in <50 years,> 900 pg / dl in 50-75 years or> 1800 pg / dl in> 75 years), chest X ray with signs of heart failure or diuretic requirement.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until discharge from the hospital (an average of 1 week) or up to one month after admission
secondary_outcome.description: Acute Kidney Injury Network (AKIN) criteria I, II or III or hemodialysis requirement
Unexpected visit (ambulatory or emergency room) secondary to clinical syndrome compatible with heart failure, with diuretics requirement

secondary_outcome.measure: Mortality from any cause during follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: All-cause mortality up to a 6 months follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospitalization due to cardiovascular cause during follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Hospitalization during follow-up secondary to acute coronary syndrome, heart failure or stroke.
Need for unexpected or unpredictable coronary revascularization due to symptoms of angina or acute coronary syndrome.
New-onset atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter, sustained ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation during hospitalization and during follow-up

arm_group.description: Patients with no significant B lines in the lung ultrasound at first 24 hours after acute myocardial infarction
Patients with significant B lines in the lung ultrasound at first 24 hours after acute myocardial infarction (pending establishing an optimal cut-off point)

intervention.description: Lung ultrasound performed with a portable device with an 8 zones protocol within the first 24 hours after and acute myocardial infarction

study_pop.textblock: All adults admitted with STEMI during 1 year in two terciary centers who meet inclusion criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults (more than 18 years) admitted with ST segment elevation acute myocardial infarction (STEMI).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Absence of coronary artery disease and myocardial injury (false positive)
- Non interpretable lung ultrasound
- Severe lung disease (fibrosis, chronic pulmonary obstructive disease with domiciliary oxygen therapy, pleural disease)
- Acute respiratory distress syndrome
- Pneumonia at admission or during hospitalization
- Follow-up inability
- Hemodialysis therapy previous to admission
- Life expectancy less than 6 months secondary to extracardiac pathology.

overall_official.affiliation: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

facility.name: Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau
